title: On-Call Schedule Management user interface
content:
If this feature is enabled, and you have the appropriate permission, the On-Call Schedule Management feature allows you to view all the groups currently on-call, and the members of the groups. For more information, see How to set up On-Call Schedule Management.

To view On-Call Schedule Management, from the main menu, select Run > On-Call Schedule. The On-Call Schedule landing page is displayed:

User interface Description
View group calendar Click this to display the calendar for the group selected in the main section. See the Group calendar section.
Main section (group list) Lists the available groups according to the selected view. For more information about groups, see Groups.
The right panel

As you select a group from the list, the right panel displays:

  • Current members who are on call.
  • Group members.

If a member is on vacation, they still appear under On-call right now (current members who are on call). This is a known limitation. However, their vacation information is displayed next to their name in the Group members list. Click the calendar icon beside the member name to display the schedule for the group member. See the Schedule section.
Group calendar

To access, from the main menu, select Run > On-Call Schedule > View group calendar.

Displays the members and the on-call shifts for the selected group. Out-of-the-box, only an administrator and all members of the group can view the group calendar.
 

Left panel:

This panel contains two sections: On call right now and Group members.

On call right now displays members who are currently on call.

Group members lists all members of the group. The time each member is next due to be on call is displayed next to their name. If a member is on vacation, their vacation information appears next to their name.

Click the calendar icon beside the member name to display the schedule for the group member. See the Schedule section.

Click to add an on-call shift. For more information, see How to set up on-call shifts.
 

Calendar:

The calendar displays the selected date range and on-call shifts. The calendar displays up to three months ahead, and one month back.

Click a shift to open it. If it's a recurring shift, an option is displayed to open the current or recurring shift.

  • Click Add on-call shift, to add a shift. For more information, see How to set up on-call shifts.
  • Click DAY, WEEK, or MONTH to have the calendar display accordingly.
  • Click the next or previous icons to move backwards or forwards in the calendar.
  • Click TODAY, to have the calendar display the current day if it's not already doing so.

To access the group calendar, from the main menu, select Run > On-Call Schedule > View group calendar.
 

Limitation: On-call shifts are not automatically adjusted to reflect vacations. If a member is on vacation, they still appear under On call right now and in the on-call shift. However, their vacation information is shown next to their name in the Group members list.
Schedule

Displays the schedule of on-call shifts for an individual in a calendar format. The calendar displays up to three months ahead, and one month back. Out-of-the-box, only an administrator, the user's manager, and all members of the group can view the schedule. Only the manager of another user can edit the other user's personal schedule.

  • Click Add vacation, to add a vacation to the calendar. For more information, see How to set up working hours.
  • Click Manage working hours, to add or edit working hours. For more information, see How to set up working hours.
  • Click DAY, WEEK, or MONTH to have the calendar display accordingly.
  • Click the next or previous icons to move backwards or forwards in the calendar.
  • Click TODAY, to have the calender display the current day if it's not already doing so.

To access the schedule, click the calendar icon beside the name of the group member.
